intro: Polyspatha, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. The plant relies on specific symbiotic relationships with mycorrhizal fungi for nutrient uptake, as it cannot photosynthesize due to the absence of chlorophyll.
